meanings.definition: A type of medieval siege engine used to hurl large stones or other projectiles.
meanings.sent1: The trebuchets were powerful weapons in ancient battles.
meanings.sent2: The army used trebuchets to launch rocks at the castle walls.
meanings.sent3: The trebuchets were so heavy that the soldiers struggled to move them.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like trebuchets, hitting him with unexpected force.
meanings.sent5: The trebuchets loomed on the horizon, ready to strike fear into the enemy.

meanings.definition: To launch or throw something using a trebuchet.
meanings.sent1: They trebucheted the pumpkins across the field for fun.
meanings.sent2: He trebucheted the ball towards the goal with all his might.
meanings.sent3: The kids trebucheted water balloons at each other on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: She trebucheted her frustrations into her diary, letting out all her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The chef trebucheted the pasta into the boiling water, expertly handling the process.
